result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .267 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) .267 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeremy J. Kuehl was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:00 am - Defendant Jeremy J. Kuehl in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Jeremy J. Kuehl in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf79, 14cf104 and 14cf179.  State moves to dismiss 14cf104 - Granted.  In case 14cf79 - State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted.  In 14CF179 - State files Amended Information - Bayne-Allison in receipt of Amended Information, waives reading.  State moves to dismiss counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Bayne-Allison/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence 14cf79
Fine $2,315 - Includes all costs - To be collected through probation as a courtesy in case 14cf149
Jail 6 months - Jail credit 2 days
DL revocation 28 months
IID 28 months
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
